member.name: T:MatrixFFN.FFN
member.summary:
FFN = feed-forward-network. A classic sigmoid netzwork with automatc data normalisation.
I though I will do it all with 'decimal' - bad try. It's still a construction side and thus i will make it the dirty way with double.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.#ctor(System.Int32[],System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
The constructor is the only way to init a new network. Including every shape of every matrix used. No shape changing at a different spot is possible.
There must be always one hidden layer minimum with this network.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This constructor loads an already saved network.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.SaveData(System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the network ( every variable ).
Info: you need to train minimum once to have something to save!

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.LoadData(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a saved network. You can use it from the constructor or in between loosing your old network. A complete init will happen to all data fields.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.NormInputArray(System.Double[])
member.summary: Delivers via the 'DataNet' ( input ) the converted values.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.NormOutputArray(System.Double[])
member.summary: Delivers via the 'DataNet' ( output ) the converted values.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.DeNormInputArray(System.Double[])
member.summary: Delivers via the 'DataNet' ( input ) the converted numbers.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.DeNormOutputArray(System.Double[])
member.summary: Delivers via the 'DataNet' ( output ) the converted numbers.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.Predict(System.Double[])
member.summary:
This function makes a 'feed forward predict' on the given data.
Normalised stays normalised. The flag 'normaliseData' will take care of that.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.Train(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary:
Trains the network with the given input/output pattern.
The 'mean square sum'-error is used.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.Train_LocalData(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Trains the network with the given input/output pattern. This version works on the loaded data ( from Excel ).
The 'mean square sum'-error is used.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.Fit(System.Double[][],System.Double[][],System.Int64)
member.summary:
Trains full epochs ( komplete datasets ) and presents every data pair once to 'Train' randomly.
Normalises the data automatic ( recommended ).

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.Fit_LocalData(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Trains full epochs ( komplete datasets ) and presents every data pair once to 'Train_LocalData' randomly.
Uses the dataset loaded with 'LoadDataFromExcel()'
Normalises the data automatic ( recommended ).

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.DataNetInit(System.Double[][],System.Double[][])
member.summary: Here the given data will be analysed to init the 'DataNet's.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.SetLearningRate(System.Double)
member.summary:
Introduces a flexible way to add/change learning values manually or even programatically. A new value leads to the removal of the old one and the coming active of the new one. It's always additional to internal management.
Possible use could be the adaption via the nets error. Programmstart takes a 1 as init. Value bigger than 1 is bigger correction and vice versa.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.ParseTopic
member.summary:
Helper function for the 'fontend' ( 'CanvasChart' ) to make the data seen after loading .
From the layersfield ( int[] ) a stringrepresentation is formed.

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.PartsNums(System.String[],System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Counts the headers in-/outputs.
member.param: the loaded headers from the excel file

member.name: M:MatrixFFN.FFN.PartArray(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Splits the datafield into two parts. Needed for the splitting of the input data read from file ( Excel ).
Best used with PartsNums().

member.name: T:MatrixFFN.Tools.CanvasChart
member.summary:
Using LINQ to show up to two lines in the chart in properly scaled way.
Allows to choose not to connect the datapoints with lines for unordered datasets and you can reduce the shown dataset to the last elements.
You can open a bigger window with the charts data. ( 'CanvasWindow' )
Chart is painted onto a given 'Canvas'.

member.name: T:MatrixFFN.Tools.DataNet
member.summary:
Die Klasse 'DatenNetz' normalisiert die realen Daten und zurück.
Das geht für reale ( Pattern ) Features.
member.remarks:
Bei Java hatte ich einen MathContext benutzt - hier gibt es 'decimal'. Dieser Datentyp soll präzise aber langsam sein. Meine Theorie war bestimmt gut und sollte auch zukunftsweisend sein. Wichtig ist die Abbildung auf das Intervall und zurück.
Deswegen werde ich alles mit 'decimal' realisieren - dachte ich. Dieser Wertetyp wird aber nicht von 'Math' unterstützt und ist eine Baustelle. So muß es mit 'double' gehen.

Das geht für reale ( Pattern ) Features.
member.remarks:
Bei Java hatte ich einen MathContext benutzt - hier gibt es 'decimal'. Dieser Datentyp soll präzise aber langsam sein. Meine Theorie war bestimmt gut und sollte auch zukunftsweisend sein. Wichtig ist die Abbildung auf das Intervall und zurück.
Deswegen werde ich alles mit 'decimal' realisieren - dachte ich. Dieser Wertetyp wird aber nicht von 'Math' unterstützt und ist eine Baustelle. So muß es mit 'double' gehen.

member.name: T:MatrixFFN.Tools.Matrix
member.summary:
This class implements the matrixcalculations for the neuronal net. But these functions can be used completly freely.
Most important here is the multiplication of two matrices using the Falk-scheme.
The functions are done in three different ways:
- operation on the interal 'Matrix'
- static Matrix function: operation on returned 'Matrix'
- static void function: operation on targeted 'Matrix' ( best speed )

member.name: T:MatrixFFN.Tools.MatrixILGPU
member.summary:
This class implements the matrixcalculations for the neuronal net. Variant for ILGPU. But these functions can be used completly freely.
Most important here is the multiplication of two matrices using the Falk-scheme.
ILGPU needs additionally to the given logic the new GPU-side, where kernels are run by calling 'Aktion's. For the speed you have to synchronize the CPU-side to your convenience if you use these functions freely.
The functions are done in three different ways:
- operation on the interal 'MatrixILGPU'
- static Matrix function: operation on returned 'MatrixILGPU'
- static void function: operation on targeted 'MatrixILGPU' ( best speed )

member.name: T:MatrixFFN.Tools.Pattern
member.summary:
This class is used to normalise data onto the sigmoid range. I use [ 0.25, 0.75 ] - this way you still can correct errors that are missing the field on the outsides.
This class can be used for any data. But categoric values are senseless as they have to be placed in an enviroment - nothing to be coped with here.
member.remarks: Important is the projection of the data onto the special interval.

member.summary:
Hier als Kernel bezeichnet, da im Threadfeld diese Funktion für alle Threads gilt und über den 'index' lokalisiert wird.
Hier darf ruhig mit einer Vereinfachung gearbeitet werden: die Länge der gleichen Kante für das Falksche-Schema für die Eleganz...
